gurmukhi: ਅੈਸੇ ਸ੍ਰਿੰਗ ਸੁਮੇਰ ਕੇ ਸੋਭਤ ਚੰਡ ਪ੍ਰਚੰਡ ||
transliteration: Aise Sring Soumer Ke Sobhat Channd Prachanndd||
translation: The powerful Chandi looks splendid on the summit of Sumeru thus;

gurmukhi: ਚੰਦ੍ਹਾਸ ਕਰਿ ਬਰ ਧਰੇ ਜਨ ਜਮ ਲੀਨੇ ਦੰਡ ||੮੦||
transliteration: Channdrahaas Kar(i) Bar Ddare Jan Jam Loone Dand||80||
translation: With the sword in her hand she seems like Yama carrying his club.80.

gurmukhi: ਕਿਸੀ ਕਾਜ ਕੋ ਦੈਤ ੲਿਕੁ ਅਾੲਿਓ ਹੈ ਤਿਹ ਠਾੲਿ ||
transliteration: Kisoo Kaaj Ko Dait Ik(u) Aaio Hai Tih Thaae||
translation: For unknown reason, one of the demons came to that site.

gurmukhi: ਨਿਰਖ ਰੂਪ ਬਰ ਚੰਡ ਕੋ ਗਿਰਿਓ ਮੂਰਛਾ ਖਾੲਿ ||੮੧||
transliteration: Nirakh Roop Bar Channd Ko Girio Moondchhaadkhaae||81||
translation: When he saw the horrible form of Kali, he fell down unconscious.81.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਠਿ ਸੰਭਾਰ ਕਰਿ ਜੋਰ ਕੈ ਕਹੀ ਚੰਡ ਸੋ ਬਾਤ ||
transliteration: Outh(i) Sanbhaar Kar(i) Jor Kai Kahoo Channd So Baat||
translation: When he came to his senses, that demon, pulling himself up, said to the goddess;

gurmukhi: ਨ੍ਰਿਪਤਿ ਸੁੰਭ ਕੋ ਭ੍ਰਾਤ ਹੌਂ ਕਹਿਓ ਬਚਨ ਸੁਕਚਾਤ ||੮੨||
transliteration: Nripat(i) Sounbh Ko Bhraat Haoun Kahio Bachanndsoukhaat||82||
translation: “I am the brother of king Sumbh,” then the added with some hesitation;82.

gurmukhi: ਤੀਨ ਲੋਕ ਜਿਨ ਬਸਿ ਕੀੲੇ ਅਤਿ ਬਲ ਭੁਜਾ ਅਖੰਡ ||
transliteration: Toon Lok Jin Bas(i) Kooe At(i) Bal Bhujaa Akhannd||
translation: “He hath brought under his control all the three worlds with his mighty armed strength;

gurmukhi: ਅੈਸੋ ਭੂਪਤਿ ਸੁੰਭ ਹੈ ਤਾਹਿ ਬਰੋ ਬਰਿ ਚੰਡ ||੮੩||
transliteration: Aiso Bhoopat(i) Sounbh Hai Taah(i) Bado Bar(i) Channd||83||
translation: “Such is the king Sumbh, O Superb Chandi, marry him.”83.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਨਿ ਰਾਕਸ ਕੀ ਬਾਤ ਕੋ ਦੇਵੀ ੳੁੱਤਰ ਦੀਨ ||
transliteration: Soun(i) Raakas Koo Baat Ko Devoo Outtar Doon||
translation: Hearing the words of the demon, the goddess replied thus:

gurmukhi: ਜੁੱਧ ਕਰੈ ਬਿਨ ਨਹਿ ਬਰੋਂ ਸੁਨਹੁ ਦੈਤ ਮਤ ਹੀਨ ||੮੪||
transliteration: Juddh Darai Bin Nah(i) Badon Sounoh Dait Mat Hoon||84||
translation: “O foolish demon, I cannot marry him without waging the war.”84.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਹ ਸੁਨ ਦਾਨਵ ਚਪਲ ਗਤਿ ਗੲਿਓ ਸੁੰਭ ਕੇ ਪਾਸ ||
transliteration: Ih Soun Daanav Chapel Gad(i) Gado Sounbh Ke Paas||
translation: Hearing this, that demon went to king Sumbh very swiftly;

gurmukhi: ਪਰ ਪਾੲਿਨ ਕਰ ਜੋਰ ਕੈ ਕਰੀ ੲੇਕ ਅਰਦਾਸ ||੮੫||
transliteration: Par Paain Kar Jor Kai Daroo Ek Ardaas||85||
translation: And with folded hands, falling at his feet, he supplicated thus:85.
